headline: Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: These TVP stuffed peppers are like what Gram used to make, except they're vegetarian, made with TVP instead of beef, and can easily be made vegan.

video.description: See how to make a hearty vegetarian main course.
video.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers

recipeInstructions.text: Combine water and rice in a small saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, about 15 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C).
Cut tops off peppers and remove seeds. Arrange peppers in a large baking dish. Chop up usable portion of the tops.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté chopped peppers and onion in hot oil until soft. Stir in textured vegetable protein and parsley. Reduce heat to low and continue cooking for 5 minutes. Mix in cooked rice and 1 1/4 cups tomato sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon mixture into peppers; top each with remaining tomato sauce.
Cover and bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes. Uncover, top each pepper with mozzarella cheese, and continue baking until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: I made it!!! It was delicious!!
These turned out great! My 13 year old son had been asking for stuffed peppers and these hit the spot. Recipe was easy to follow and they were simple to make. Yum!

Instead of stuffing the peppers, I sliced them into quarters (since I only had 2 bell peppers) and laid them out flat. I mixed in the mozzarella and Parmesan with the rice mixture and also topped it off with both cheeses after 45 min of baking. Not bad but needs a bit more flavor. I will definitely make again.
Textured vegetable protein is Tofu
Added ground beef—delicious
Delicious. Everyone liked it.

My boyfriend and I made this tonight and it turned out AMAZING! We substituted the tomato sauce for the already made leftover pasta sauce (tomato based, which had sausage and ground beef in it already). Sooo good! 

I could eat bell peppers all day if I could so I will definitely make this again soon
add ground turkey. Very good kuddos to ya!!! No photo
Delicious!!
Needed a lot more seasonings, seemed flat tasting. Didn't need the 1/4 cup oil, 1 TBS would do. My original Mom's recipe is much better.
Needed a lot more seasonings, seemed flat tasting. Didn't need the 1/4 cup oil, 1 TBS would do. My original Mom's recipe is much better.
Will Make It Again , Very Tasty And Very Easy To Make .

I added a half can of chilis in adobo and it REALLY took this dish to the next level in terms of smoky rich flavor. I can imagine it would be a little bland without the chilis/adobo addition. Topped with cheddar, sour cream, and hot sauce. Will make again with these variations!

These were excellent. I never have parsley so used cilantro. Really delicious. I used some mushrooms instead of the vegetable protein. My non vegetarian, green pepper hating brother loved them too. Definitely a keeper.
I got 4 rather large peppers but made the stuffing per the recipe except for 1/2 cup of onions sautéed with the beef. Excellent. I’ll do this again!
I followed the recipe and loved it. I only changed the cheese. I used mizithra after they came out of the oven.
Easy to make, filling and satisfying. I couldn’t find textured vegetables, so I used vegetarian crumble intimation meat; the hubs loved it and couldn’t tell the difference from real meat.
No changes but not my favorite by far. Not good next day. To many vegetables so meat didnt hold them together
Virtually no flavor with this stock recipe. Very bland.
I was looking for a more simple stuff bell pepper recipe. And I found it with this one. What I like I do not have to the bell peppers first. I can just stuff them and put them in the oven.
I used cliantro and cumin, and chirizo soy crumbles. Delish!
These are great
It was okay - I used ground beef, and pasta sauce. It just wasn’t flavorful enough. Sub par.
I definitely did something wrong. The peppers were not soft and did not taste good. The stuffing taste very good.
Absolutely delicious. I would just add more cheese.
Excellent. We loved it.
Added some more cheese and meat. Delicious. Thank you.

I loved it! I used chipotle black bean crumbles instead of the textured soy protein and added some bushes fiesta black beans. It was amazing! A definite keeper! A big thank you to whoever came up with this recipe!

Really good stuffed peppers. I used fire roasted tomatoes with some seasonings and cooked them down. Then poured over the peppers. Topped with grated Parmesan cheese when I took them out of the oven. Highly recommend.

Really good stuffed peppers. I used fire roasted tomatoes with some seasonings and cooked them down. Then poured over the peppers. Topped with grated Parmesan cheese when I took them out of the oven. Highly recommend.
Great Dish, Just my Wife and I. Made the mixture for two BP's one night and had the other two three days later. Easy, quick and good.

I made these tonight. Instead of parsley I used Mrs Dash. No salt. I also used pepper jack cheese and Italian blend cheese on top. I used yellow, orange and red bell peppers too. My son and I loved them. My 10 yr old granddaughter even liked them too.
Easy to make. Needs a little more flavor. I think next time I will use more tomato sauce, both in the mixture and on top.

I didn't know what "Texture Vegetable Protein was so I looked it up here it is: Textured or texturized vegetable protein (TVP), also known as textured soy protein (TSP), soy meat, or soya chunks is a defatted soy flour product, a by-product of extracting soybean oil. It is often used as a meat analogue or meat extender. It is quick to cook, with a protein content comparable to certain meats.
Simple and tasty recipe. My whole family liked them.
So easy and good. I add grated Monterey Jack cheese on top. Adds a little extra mmmmmm.
Peppers should have been precooked. They were not tender. Filling overcooked by the time the peppers were tender. Would not recommend.
These were excellent! I used a can of tomato pasted and half a jar of spaghetti sauce, along with some extra chopped bell pepper and sauteed onions in the stuffing. Really yummy!

Amazing. I did make a few changes, some on accident! I used Uncle Bens 90 second microwave white rice and accidentally added the whole package :/ It would have been even better if I hadn't. I also added some shredded cheddar cheese to the mixture before baking and a sprinkle on top of the mozzarella at the end. All in all this was absolutely delicious - even my 9 yr old who said it was going to be gross cleaned her plate. 10/10 will make again.
I mixed sweet sausage and ground beef it was delicious!!

Substituted ground beef for the veggie protein and put jalapeno jack cheese on top. Would have been 5 stars, but nowhere did it say to precook the peppers. So glad I did because they came out just right.

I understand vegetable protein for vegans but actually u don't need it for who is not vegan. It should be used chopped onions (cooked in olive oil before adding the ingredients) and dill as well as parsley. I put dried blackcurrant and just a bit cinnamon for the zest as well. For saucepan cooking 1 onion chopped in olive oil until it gets golden color then add washed and clean rice and add a bit hot water it should be half cooked. after that u can add veggies and dried blackcurrant and 1 spoon of tomato puree as well as spices(thyme,mint,blackpepper,salt)(don't cook rice with blackcurrant it will change the color). then u can fill the peppers with the mixture (can cover with tomato or pepper again) put in the saucepan and add a bit water mixed with tomato puree again (will be more delicious).Shud be cooked simmer. max 30 min. It shud be eaten cold cos it is with olive oil and doesn't include mince meat. When you serve it you can add some yoghurt-garlic mix on the top of it if u not vegan. I am a mediterranean person and giving you original recipe. I am not using any measure cos I am doing automatically but wanted to give you an idea. By the way when u choosing peppers in the shop look at the bottom and buy flat ones cos they need to stand when they cooking. Secondly, don't fill the peppers until its full leave 1 cm space in case of swollen rice. Hope this helps!!
Great recipe! Even my husband who doesn't like anything made with tomatoes loved it! I will definitely make it again

This dinner was absolutely yummy!! My kids hate green peppers and this was a hit with them! I changed just a few things such as I did not put the sauce on every 15mins, I just let it bake through, also added added Mozzarella Cheese to them....no words on how yummy! Definitely NO left overs and so, so, so easy to make!!
Great recipe for serving a crowd.
My 14 year old son made this for our family for dinner and it was awsome
It was spicy but not too much. . . .perfect. The whole recipe gave us one large dinner for two and two small lunches. Loved it and will make it often!
easy to prepare and very good
I used ground turkey and orzo instead of rice- delicious! Also melted fresh mozzarella on top at end of baking
I love it left the recipe as is. They all love it.
Omitted the Italian seasoning for the second batch.
I added some bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese. I would cook these a bit longer if you like your peppers a bit softer. Cooking them in the crockpot is ideal.
This was an easy to make dinner. I did par boil the peppers so it did not have to bake as long. I also added some fresh off the cob corn since it was in season. It turned out great.

I use a mix of red, green and orange peppers. Instead of cutting the tops off, I cut them in half. I accidentally cut a pepper the wrong way, so I fixed it up and sautéed it with the onions. I used Beyond Meat veggie crumbles. They are made from pea protein. I was making these before a concert, so I wanted to shorten the cooking time a bit. I boiled the peppers in salted water for 3 minutes, then put in an ice bath to cool. These came out really good. I'd definitely make them again.
I used jasmine rice and seasoned with garam masala, cumin and tumeric. I also rehydrated the tvp and added in sauteed jalapeños, diced tomatoes and garlic to the onion and pepper mix.

This was a great base recipe but I think it would have been a little bland with out a few changes. I added a bit of cumin and cayenne pepper when sautéing the veggies, I also added some crushed garlic. Like others, I used brown rice instead of white. I mixed in cheese in the mix as well as putting it on top at the very end. I also mixed in tomato sauce (I used spaghetti sauce). It was very good. Very filling and very rich, will probably just make half next time for my family of two.
It was a easy recipe to follow. My husband enjoyed it very much.
Easy and delicious!
For four peppers, I would recommend using 1 cup of dehydrated TVP. I hydrated the TVP in 7/8 cup of vegetable broth and it was very yummy.
Excellent dish! Never would of imagined! Will be making these again! Easy! Highly recommend!
delicous, only thing is not enough seasonings as my bro in law says, but i just add whatever i want after its done being cooked , its great and works well when frozen and reheated later as well

I used real beef because I had some in the freezer i needed to use at the time. I'll use soy next time. But I would make it again even just based on the other ingredients, amounts suggested and Instructions. I did use orange bell peppers instead if green. Green are too sour to me. I also added a scoop of minced garlic from a jar and a fresh chopped jalapeño.

I gave this recipe 4 stars because of the inattention to the amount of TVP. I like the recipe, however, 8 oz of TVP (weighed on a kitchen scale) would have ruined it. However, 1 cup,worked fine. After learning that the cup measure is for liquids, I weigh most of my ingredients. So, on my kitchen scale 1 cup of TVP weighed 3 oz. I also mixed 1 cup shredded cheese into the mixture, and I will sprinkle some on top after baking. I like this recipe for days when I don't want a heavier protein like meat.

That was the first thing that also came to my mind...what on Earth is textured vegetable protein? Disregard my rating as I cant post this unless I give it a rating. Would like to make but dont know what this ingredient is.
I think the vegetable protein is vegetable broth.

My husband and I couldn't get enough! Will definitely make this again and again. Only changes I made were to use red peppers instead of green. Added some garlic, cumin, and Anaheim peppers and mixed in the mozzarella cheese with the filling :) yummy!! Highly recommend!
Used red pep
I used brown rice and added black beans and yellow squash. The turn her nose up at everything child had two peppers.
We substituted lean ground beef for the textured vegetable protein and used about 3 cups of tomato sauce. We like it saucy. ??. Otherwise delicious!!

Used some other reviewers suggestions such as using a can of beans for protein and 1/4 tsp. of cumin and garlic sautéed with the onion. I will try with some more spices next time. I used a wild rice blend. I was quite hungry and thought the peppers looked pretty cooked at 22 min. so I put some cheese (soy cheese for hubby and I) on, turned the oven off and let it set in the warm oven for several minutes. The peppers turned out to be a bit crispy still which didn't bother me, but I'm guessing they could've used some more cook time. This is a keeper.
This was pretty good. It was the first time I tried these and am pleasantly impressed. I added about half an ounce of red wine vinegar and a sliver of jalapeno to give it some edge.

This was excellent, I added 1 1/2 teaspoons Italian sausage seasoning (available at a spice shop) when I added the TVP and omitted the parsley used an organic basmati whole grain rice, and everyone loved the flavor of the dish, this is definitely one to make for company.

Textured vegetable protein is a vegetarian substitute for ground beef made from soy. You can find it in the vegetarian section of the refrigerated food aisle it tastes good, or you can just use ground beef I guess.

I found Textured Vegetable Protien (Bob's Red Mill brand) at the bake goods section in my grocery store First time cooking with TVP, Forgot to rehydrate the stuff before putting in preparation big mistake! Turn out very dry with no flavor. Would try again the right way hoping it will would taste better.
Relatively tasteless

Even my carnivore husband loves this recipe. For those asking about TVP, it's called "crumbles" by both Boca (c) and Morningstar Farms (c). I've been switching out ground beef for TVP for a while, and it was nice to see a recipe already using it. I used brown rice instead of white and sometimes I use my own marinara.
Very Good! I used quinua and prego basil and garlic pasta sauce. I also recommend putting cheese in with the rice ahead of time.
This was a delicious vegetarian stuffed pepper recipe! I used all of the ingredients except the textured vegetable protein because I couldn't find it in the grocery store; instead, I used stuffing.
Enjoyed these fpeppers,especially because they are vegetarian.

This is the first time I've made stuffed peppers and they turned out excellent! I used black beans as another reviewer suggested and it was a great vegetarian meal. My kids and husband just ate the stuffing out of the peppers, but at least I got them to do that!!
Awesome! The only thing you might want to add is some extra seasoning, but my wife and I love it!

With the changes I made, I give this 5 stars.
I used Quinoa instead of rice. Quinoa is very low in Cholesterol and Sodium. It is also a good source of Magnesium and Phosphorus, and a very good source of Manganese. One cup has 8.14 grams of protein. I also used 1/3 cup of taco seasoning, one can of drained and rinsed black peppers and topped the cooked peppers with salsa. They were delicious and very nutritious!

I made this for dinner and was pleasantly surprised. Stuffed peppers was my favorite meal, but since I stopped eating meat I didn't know how to make a substitute. This does it for me! I would make a few changes. Parboil the peppers for a minute or two before stuffing, use marinara sauce (I like Prego) instead of the plain tomato sauce, no salt and Morningstar griller crumbles. I used extra sauce to pour over the peppers.

I'm not a vegetarian either, but I am cooking for one. We didn't have tofu in our grocery store, so I substituted using black beans, I also added cumin, chili powder and cayenne pepper for a kick. The peppers are currently in the oven and it's making an awesome smell. Thanks for the recipe it was a help.

I used 1 lb of ground beef for 4 peppers, as well as a half can of meat-loaf-tomato-sauce. They turned out well. Next time, I'm adding a little cheese to my beef/rice/onion mix for extra flavor. Tasted great--we're not vegetarians, so these modifications worked for us!

These are really good. The only thing I changed was I did not have TVP as I live in a small town and no one here carries that, I substituted navy white beans, I precooked them to almost done and precooked the rice to done. I left tops on my peppers, for appearance.

Had some excess bell peppers from the garden and decided to make stuffed bell peppers. I used ground beef instead of TVP and used garlic spaghetti sauce rather than just tomato sauce and they came out great. My husband and cousin ate the left over bell peppers and stuffing the next day for lunch and was still as yummy as the night before! Thanks for the great recipe :)

These were absolutely fantastic and will definitely be going into our repertoire of menu items:-) I used the Boca Ground Crumbles...and two red plus two green peppers to add a little color. We also did not have white rice, so I used Jasmine rice. Otherwise, left it exactly the same. I will say that the prep time for me was around 50 minutes, but soooo worth it!

Very delish recipe! I made it just like the recipe said and it turned out perfect! I used Morning Star crumbles for the vege protein and you couldn't even tell it wasn't real ground beef. My hubby loved them too and he is a meat kinda guy. Can't wait to make it again soon.

Not being a vegetarian, I used lean ground beef. I put oregano and garlic in while cooking the meat/onions/peppers. I also mixed in about 1/4 cup of sharp white cheddar after adding the rice and tomato sauce. Then topped with sharp white cheddar. To cut down on cooking time, I steam the peppers in the microwave with a small amount of water in the bottom of the dish, for about 8 minutes.
These turned out wonderfully! I didn't have the textured vegetable protein (and to be honest, I don't even know what that is!), but it tasted great without it.
Love this recipe, instead of tomatoe sauce, I used vegetable speghatti sauce and it turned out awesome!

I thought this recipe was really good. My household responded positively to it despite the fact there was no meat. I actually substituted the TVP with black beans and used brown rice. I also added different spices and hot sauces to make the end result a bit spicier. All in all, the meal was well received.

My boyfriend made this dish for the family and it was great. (Even better the next day). He used yellow bells, ground turkey and basil instead of tofu and oregano and brown instead of white rice. We'd love to try it with the tofu next time.
Delicious! Made as written, and the family loved it - including the picky 7-year-old. My husband has requested I put this in the "family favourites" binder.
I made these for a dinner with friends. I went for more of a fiesta theme and I used rotel instead of tomato sauce, mexican cheese instead of mozzarella, and added taco seasoning. Tasted great!
This is great. I replaed the tomato sauce by condensed tomato soup for added taste. Textured vegetable proteine also called TVP can be bought at health food stores and at stores like Bulk Barn

Good vegetarian main dish. I used brown rice instead of white and good jarred spaghetti sauce instead of the tomato sauce and added fresh garlic in with the onions but used everything else as listed. The dish was really good. The next day I sliced the left over pepper and put in a french roll. Tasted just like a meatball sub lol. Thanks!

Did NOT use vegetable protein...instead used ground turkey. Added some turmeric, cajun seasoning and saracha sauce to the filling. I also had used three large peppers and ended up needing the same amount of filling ingredients. Overall, good recipe...just add meat if you're not a fan of or have no idea what textured vegetable protein is. haha
